cnd9:1.2: Whatever they told me before, before Gotama's teaching,
cnd9:1.3: Like this that was, like this that will be, that is all rumors,
cnd9:1.4: That was all an increase in theory, I didn't have much joy there.

cnd9:2.1: "What they told me before": Bāvari Brāhmaṇa and all other his teachers, they
cnd9:2.2: explain, teach, inform, establish, uncover, analyze, clarify their own views,
cnd9:2.3: their own likes, inclinations, opinions, intentions.
cnd9:3.1: "[Like this Venerable Hemaka]": "Like this," the continuation of the sentences,
cnd9:3.2: the connection of the words, the completion of the sentences, the combination of
cnd9:3.3: words, this is the order of the sentence, which is "like this." "Venerable,"
cnd9:3.4: this is a synonym of love, respect, and obedience. "Hemaka," the name, title,
cnd9:3.5: security of the Brāhmaṇa, title, word, phrase.
cnd9:4.1: "Before the teachings of Gotama": Before the teachings of Gotama, on the other
cnd9:4.2: side of the teachings of Gotama, prior to the teachings of Gotama; the Buddha's
cnd9:4.3: precepts, the precepts of the victors, the precepts of the Tathāgata, the first
cnd9:5.1: "Like this and that was, like this and that will be": Legend that it was like
cnd9:5.2: this, and that it will be like this.
cnd9:6.1: "It's all rumors": It's all rumors, hearsay, inheritance, the teachings of the
cnd9:6.2: scriptures, logical inferences, reasoning, thoughts about theories, opinions
cnd9:6.3: accepted after contemplation, and they tell that they are not personally proven
cnd9:6.4: by themselves, not the self-proven method.
cnd9:7.1: "That is all an increase in theory": It is all an increase in theory, an
cnd9:7.2: increase in seeking, ...thinking, ...desire, malicious seeking, persecution, the
cnd9:7.3: thinking about land, the thinking about death, the thinking related to sympathy
cnd9:7.4: with others, the thinking related to the benefit of respect and reputation, the
cnd9:7.5: thinking related to not being scorned.
cnd9:8.1: "I didn't have great joy there": I didn't have great joy there, didn't receive
cnd9:8.2: it, didn't prove it, didn't obtain it.
cnd9:9.1: <em>54 : Please tell me the Dhamma of the destruction of craving; Muni!
cnd9:9.2: Anyone who knows which and has mindfulness
cnd9:9.3: Can live through the love in the world.

cnd9:9.5: Anyone who knows which and has mindfulness

cnd9:9.8: Anyone who knows which and has mindfulness
cnd9:9.9: Can live through the love in the world.
cnd9:10.1: "Please tell me": "You," the Blessed One. "Tell the Dhamma," the beginning is
cnd9:10.2: good, the middle is good, the end is good; the meaning is correct, the phrase is
cnd9:10.3: correct; only complete, pure Brahma: four mindfulnesses, four righteousnesses,
cnd9:10.4: four divine bases, five senses, five powers, seven enlightenment factors, eight
cnd9:10.5: holy paths, Nibbāna and the path leading to Nibbāna; please declare, please
cnd9:10.6: explain, please teach, please inform, please establish, please uncover, please
cnd9:11.1: "The destruction of thirst, Muni": "Thirst," desire for form, desire for sounds,
cnd9:11.2: desire for smells, desire for tastes, desire for touches, desire for
cnd9:11.3: acquisition, desire for wealth, desire for sons, desire for life, the state of
cnd9:11.4: desire, hope, prayer, greedy appearance, possessing greed, inquiring for profit,
cnd9:11.5: illegal greed, improper greed, hope, envy, desire for desire, desire for
cnd9:11.6: nothingness, desire for form, formless thirst, extinguished thirst, form thirst,
cnd9:11.7: sound thirst, smell thirst, taste thirst, touch thirst, dhamma thirst, torrent,
cnd9:11.8: harness, binding, clinging, obstacles, covering, defilements, potential trends
cnd9:11.9: of troubles, entanglement, vines, stinginess, suffering roots, causes of
cnd9:11.10: suffering, occurrence of suffering, magical nets, magical hooks, magical food,
cnd9:11.11: the realm of the devil, the residence of the devil, the state of the devil, the
cnd9:11.12: bondage of the devil, the river of thirst, the net of thirst, the rope of
cnd9:11.13: thirst, the sea of thirst, craving, greed, and the root of unwholesomeness.
cnd9:12.1: "Muni," Muni is called wisdom, understanding, simple selection, investigation,
cnd9:12.2: discernment, recognition, discrimination, close observation, inspection, learned
cnd9:12.3: virtuous wisdom, proficiency, cleverness, study, reflection, review,
cnd9:12.4: contemplation, examination, general comprehensive wisdom, vipassanā, right
cnd9:12.5: knowledge, stabbing rod, wisdom root, wisdom sword, wisdom palace, wisdom
cnd9:12.6: brightness, wisdom light, no delusion, choice of dhamma, right view. The Blessed
cnd9:12.7: One has the wisdom of Muni, reaching Muni. There are three Muni (perfect
cnd9:12.8: virtues): body Muni, language Muni, intention Muni.
cnd9:13.1: What is the body of Muni? The three types of body and evil deeds are cut off as
cnd9:13.2: the Muni position; the three types of good behaviors are the Muni position; the
cnd9:13.3: wisdom in the body is the Muni position; the knowledge of the body is the Muni
cnd9:13.4: position; walking the Path with (higher) knowledge is the body of Muni; the
cnd9:13.5: abandonment of desire and greed, cut off, as the Muni; the fourth jhāna
cnd9:13.6: extinction of the body is the position of Muni.
cnd9:14.1: What is the language of Muni? The abandonment of the four types of evil deeds of
cnd9:14.2: language is the position of Muni; the four types of good acts of language are
cnd9:14.3: the position of Muni; the wisdom of linguistic objects is the position of Muni;
cnd9:14.4: the knowledge of language is the position of Muni; and knowing the path of all
cnd9:14.5: acts is the position of Muni; the abandonment of desire and greed of language is
cnd9:14.6: the position of Muni; the second jhāna cessation of language is the position of
cnd9:15.1: What is intention Muni? The three types of deeds of intention and evil deeds are
cnd9:15.2: the Muni position; the three types of good deeds are the Muni position; the
cnd9:15.3: wisdom in the mind-object is the Muni position; the knowledge of the heart is
cnd9:15.4: the Muni position; the one that walks the Path with knowledge is the position of
cnd9:15.5: Muni; the desire and greed of the heart being judged is the position of Muni;
cnd9:15.6: the desire to perish the mind is the position of Muni.
cnd9:16.1: "Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd9:16.2: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say he is the one who cuts everything.
cnd9:16.3: Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd9:16.4: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say that they are those who have been cleansed of evil."
cnd9:17.1: The six types of Muni have these three modes of Muni: Muni at home, Muni without
cnd9:17.2: a home, Muni with learning, Muni without learning, Bhikkhu Muni, Muni (of the)
cnd9:17.3: Muni. Which is at home? Those laymen who have seen the footsteps and have
cnd9:17.4: learned the precepts, these are at home. Which are homeless Muni? Those bhikkhus
cnd9:17.5: who have seen the footsteps and who have learned the precepts are homeless Muni.
cnd9:17.6: There are seven types of learning for learning Muni, Arahant for non-learning
cnd9:17.7: Muni, and Bhikkhu Buddha as Bhikkhu Muni. Muni (of) Muni is called Tathāgata,
cnd9:18.1: "Non-wise is Muni, a foolish and ignorant man,
cnd9:18.2: After raising the scale, take the top one and become a wise man.
cnd9:18.3: Avoid all evils, that Muni became Muni because of that,
cnd9:18.4: Everyone who understands the (inner and outer sum) in the world,
cnd9:18.5: Because that is said to be Muni.
cnd9:18.6: Who knows all the inside and outside of the world,
cnd9:18.7: The unwholesome and the good behind the Dhamma,
cnd9:18.8: Everyone who is supported (respected) by heaven and man,
cnd9:18.9: Beyond staining and the net, he is Muni."
cnd9:19.1: "Anyone who knows the mindfulness after knowing": ....
cnd9:20.1: "Able to live through love in the world": "Love" is called craving, which is
cnd9:20.2: greed, ...(omitted) unwholesome roots. "Being in love," what does it mean to be
cnd9:20.3: loving? The "spread" is love, the "broad" is love, the "vast" is love, the
cnd9:20.4: "incorrect" is love, "it forces" is love, "it seizes" is love, "fraud" is love,
cnd9:20.5: "poisonous root" is love, "poisonous fruit" is love, "poison is used" is love;
cnd9:20.6: or, "the vast thirst for love": in form..., sound..., smell..., taste...
cnd9:20.7: (omitted), the material realm, the formless realm, the desire realm, the four
cnd9:20.8: constituents, the five endowments, past, future, now, the enlarged attachments
cnd9:20.9: in the dhammas that are seen, heard, felt, and knowable, are love. "In the
cnd9:20.10: world," in the world of suffering, in the world of humans, (omitted)..., and in
cnd9:20.11: the world of being. "Able to survive the love in the world": "The love in the
cnd9:20.12: world, he can pass through, surpass, pass, transcend, and overcome mindfully"

cnd9:22.1: "Here in what you see, what you hear, what you feel, what you know": "What you
cnd9:22.2: see" is seen by the eyes. "What you hear" is heard by your ears. "What you feel"
cnd9:22.3: is smelled by your nose, tasted by your tongue, and physical contact.
cnd9:23.1: "In terms of desire, Hemaka": What is the lovely and desirable in the world?
cnd9:23.2: Eyes are lovely and desirable in the world, ears are...(omitted), nose is...,
cnd9:23.3: tongue is..., the body..., meaning..., form, sound, smell, taste, touch, the
cnd9:23.5: tongue-consciousness, body-consciousness, mind-consciousness, eye touch, ear
cnd9:23.6: touch, nose touch, tongue tough, body touch, mind touch, eye touch is lovely and
cnd9:23.7: desirable in the world; ear touch is born and felt..., nose touch..., tongue
cnd9:23.8: touch, body touch, mind being born and felt is lovely and desirable in the
cnd9:23.9: world; desire is in the world..., sound is in the world..., smell..., taste,
cnd9:23.10: thoughts of touch, thoughts of the dhamma, thoughts of form, ...of sound, ...of
cnd9:23.11: smell, taste...; craving for form..., craving for sound..., ...smell, taste,
cnd9:23.12: touch, Dhamma; search for form..., ...sound..., taste, touch, Dhamma; form is..,
cnd9:23.13: sound is..., smell, taste, touch, Dhamma is lovely and agreeable in the world.
cnd9:24.1: "Expulsion of desire and greed": "Desire, greed," that is the desire of desire,
cnd9:24.2: the greed of desire, the joy of desire, the thirst of desire, the love of
cnd9:24.3: desire, the enthusiasm of desire, and the obsession of desire, desire's taking,
cnd9:24.4: desire's torrent, desire's harness (binding), desire's clinging, desire's cover.
cnd9:24.5: "The driving away from desire and greed": The cessation of desire and greed; the
cnd9:24.6: calming down of desire and greed; the stopping of desire and greed; non-living
cnd9:25.1: "The realm of Nibbāna, immortality": The realm of Nibbāna is the realm of
cnd9:25.2: rescue, refuge, shelter, and no terror. "Immortality," always, firm, eternal,

cnd9:27.1: "After knowing this, all those who have mindfulness": "This," non-living,
cnd9:27.2: Nibbāna, that is the cessation of all actions, the cessation of all attachments,
cnd9:27.3: the extinction of craving, greed, extinction, and Nibbāna. "After," after
cnd9:27.4: knowing, after understanding, after measuring, after judging, after separating,
cnd9:27.5: after clarifying. "All actions are impermanent," after knowing...; "all actions
cnd9:27.6: are suffering,"...; "all dhammas are not-self,"...; "any collection of dhammas
cnd9:27.7: is an extinction of dhammas,".... "Who..." is an Arahant who has exhausted all
cnd9:27.8: his troubles. The "mindful person" is mindful in four ways: when practicing
cnd9:27.9: mindfulness on the body, when practicing mindfulness on perception, when
cnd9:27.10: watching the mind in the heart, when the practice is in line with the teachings,
cnd9:28.1: And again in four ways: the state of avoiding non-mind, the state of the Dhamma
cnd9:28.2: that should be done to the mind, the state of the Dhamma that is obstructed by
cnd9:28.3: the mind, the state of the mindfulness factor (phase) not being forgotten.
cnd9:29.1: And again in four ways: the state of possessing mindfulness, the state of
cnd9:29.2: abiding in mindfulness, the state of experiencing mindfulness, and the state of
cnd9:30.1: And again in four ways: with the state of being mindful as the object of
cnd9:30.2: mindfulness, the quiet state as the object, the calm state as the object, the
cnd9:30.3: state of silence; the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the
cnd9:30.4: Dhamma, the recollection of the Saṅgha, the precepts, the alms, of the mind;
cnd9:30.5: mindfulness of the in and out breath, of death, of the body, of silence; all
cnd9:30.6: mindfulness, free-mindfulness..., the path without a fork, are called
cnd9:30.7: mindfulness. Having been fully possessed, reaching fully, possessing, arriving,
cnd9:30.8: with this thought, he is called mindful.
cnd9:31.1: "A person who sees the Dhamma, a person who is completely cooled": "The one who
cnd9:31.2: sees the Dhamma," the one who knows the Dhamma, the one who measures the Dhamma,
cnd9:31.3: the judge of the Dhamma, the clearer of the Dhamma, the person who knows the
cnd9:31.4: Dhamma. The seer of the Dhamma of "all actions are impermanent"..., of "all
cnd9:31.5: actions are non-self"..., of "ignorance is the cause of action"..., "any
cnd9:31.6: collection of dhammas is an extinction"...; a seer, a knower of Dhamma, a judge
cnd9:31.7: of Dhamma, a clearer of Dhamma. "Completely cooled," making the state of cooled
cnd9:31.8: greed, anger..., foolishness..., resent..., unscrupulousness...; the silent
cnd9:31.9: state, the calmed state, the extinguished state, the cooled state, the departed
cnd9:31.10: state, and the ceased state are silent, ceased, calmed, cooled, and stopped.
cnd9:32.1: "And they are always silent": "Quiet," making the cooled and silenced state of
cnd9:32.2: greed, ...aggression..., ignorance, ...anger, ...hate ...; the silent state, the
cnd9:32.3: calmed state, the ceased state, the extinguished state, the cooled state, the
cnd9:32.4: departed state, and the ceased state are silent, silent, calmed, cooled, and
cnd9:32.5: stopped." "They" are Arahants, those who have exhausted their troubles.
cnd9:32.6: "Always," always, all the time, eternally, constantly, continuously,
cnd9:32.7: uninterrupted, successively, like the rise of water waves without intervals, the
cnd9:32.8: continuous accompanying and touching, before noon, afternoon, first night,
cnd9:32.9: midnight, and after night, in the dark moon, bright moon, rainy season, winter,
cnd9:32.10: summer, in youth, middle age, and old age.
cnd9:33.1: "Crossing through the world of love": Love is called thirst, which is greed,
cnd9:33.2: lust, acquiescence, conformity, joy, desire, obsession, taking, contaminated,
cnd9:33.3: disturbance, fraud, (reincarnation) root cause, (bitter) fertility, tailoring
cnd9:33.4: (greed), net, river, bondage, rope, attachment, accumulation, companionship,
cnd9:33.5: desire, intimate interaction, forest, jungle, love, expectation, relationship,
cnd9:33.6: desire for form, desire for sounds, desire for smells, desire for tastes, desire
cnd9:33.7: for touches, desire for acquisition, desire for wealth, desire for sons, desire
cnd9:33.8: for life, the state of desire, hope, prayer, greedy appearance, possessing
cnd9:33.9: greed, inquiring for profit, illegal greed, improper greed, hope, envy, desire
cnd9:33.10: for desire, desire for nothingness, desire for form, formless thirst,
cnd9:33.11: extinguished thirst, form thirst, sound thirst, smell thirst, taste thirst,
cnd9:33.12: touch thirst, dhamma thirst, torrent, harness, binding, clinging, obstacles,
cnd9:33.13: covering, defilements, potential trends of troubles, entanglement, vines,
cnd9:33.14: stinginess, suffering roots, causes of suffering, occurrence of suffering,
cnd9:33.15: magical nets, magical hooks, magical food, the realm of the devil, the residence
cnd9:33.16: of the devil, the state of the devil, the bondage of the devil, the river of
cnd9:33.17: thirst, the net of thirst, the rope of thirst, the sea of thirst, craving,
cnd9:33.18: greed, and the root of unwholesomeness. "Love": What is the meaning of love...
cnd9:33.19: (omitted). "In the world": The world of suffering.... "Overcoming the love in
cnd9:33.20: the world": The love in the world, he has passed, has surpassed, has
cnd9:34.1: At the end of these verses... "The Blessed One is my teacher, I am a disciple."
